storyTitle: As Attendance System Administrator, I want to integrate biometric devices to achieve real-time attendance data collection

testCases.title: Validate successful connection and data reception from biometric devices
preconditions: Admin user has valid credentials and access to admin interface
Biometric device is powered on and network accessible
Biometric device API credentials are available
Attendance database is operational and accessible
System has network connectivity to biometric device

steps.action: Log into the admin interface with valid administrator credentials
steps.expectedResult: Admin dashboard is displayed successfully

steps.action: Navigate to biometric device configuration section
steps.expectedResult: Device configuration page is displayed with connection settings form

steps.action: Enter biometric device API endpoint, authentication credentials, and device identifier
steps.expectedResult: Configuration fields accept input and display entered values

steps.action: Click 'Test Connection' button to verify device connectivity
steps.expectedResult: System displays 'Connection Successful' message with device status as 'Connected'

steps.action: Save the biometric device configuration
steps.expectedResult: Configuration is saved successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Simulate an attendance event on the biometric device by scanning a registered employee fingerprint
steps.expectedResult: Biometric device registers the scan and sends event data to the system

steps.action: Monitor the admin dashboard real-time data feed for the attendance event
steps.expectedResult: Attendance event appears in the dashboard within 1 minute showing employee ID, timestamp, and device ID

steps.action: Navigate to attendance database query interface or run database query to retrieve the latest attendance record
steps.expectedResult: Database query returns the attendance record successfully

steps.action: Compare the database record fields (employee ID, timestamp, device ID, event type) with the original biometric device output
steps.expectedResult: All event data fields match exactly between biometric device output and database record

steps.action: Verify the timestamp difference between event occurrence and database storage
steps.expectedResult: Time difference is less than 1 minute, confirming real-time data collection

postconditions: Biometric device remains connected and operational
Valid attendance event is stored in database
Admin dashboard shows active device status
System is ready to receive subsequent attendance events

testCases.title: Verify system handles corrupted attendance data
preconditions: Biometric device is connected and configured in the system
Admin has access to admin dashboard
Error logging mechanism is enabled
Database contains existing valid attendance records for comparison
Test environment allows simulation of corrupted data transmission

steps.action: Access the test data simulation tool or API endpoint for sending attendance events
steps.expectedResult: Test tool or API endpoint is accessible and ready to accept test data

steps.action: Prepare corrupted attendance event data with missing employee ID field
steps.expectedResult: Corrupted test payload is created with incomplete data structure

steps.action: Send the corrupted attendance event data to the system via biometric device API endpoint
steps.expectedResult: System receives the corrupted data transmission

steps.action: Observe system response and check for error response code (e.g., 400 Bad Request)
steps.expectedResult: System rejects the data with appropriate error response code and validation error message

steps.action: Navigate to system error logs or logging dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Error log interface displays recent error entries

steps.action: Search for the error entry corresponding to the corrupted data submission with timestamp and error details
steps.expectedResult: Error log contains entry with timestamp, error type 'Data Validation Failed', details about missing employee ID, and source device information

steps.action: Access the admin dashboard and navigate to error notifications section
steps.expectedResult: Admin dashboard displays error notifications panel

steps.action: Verify the error notification displays details including timestamp, device ID, error type, and description
steps.expectedResult: Error notification is visible with complete details: 'Corrupted data rejected - Missing employee ID from Device [device-id] at [timestamp]'

steps.action: Query the attendance database for records matching the timestamp of the corrupted data submission
steps.expectedResult: Database query returns no record for the corrupted event timestamp

steps.action: Verify database integrity by checking that only valid records exist and record count has not increased
steps.expectedResult: Database contains only valid attendance records with complete required fields, confirming corrupted data was not stored

steps.action: Send additional corrupted data with invalid timestamp format
steps.expectedResult: System rejects data and logs error with description 'Invalid timestamp format'

steps.action: Confirm no corrupted records from any test iteration are present in the database
steps.expectedResult: Final database verification shows zero corrupted records and all existing records are valid

postconditions: No corrupted data exists in the attendance database
All error events are logged with complete details
Admin dashboard displays all error notifications
System continues to accept valid attendance events normally
Data integrity is maintained

testCases.title: Test device disconnection and automatic reconnection
preconditions: Biometric device is connected and actively sending attendance data
Admin is logged into the admin dashboard
System has automatic reconnection feature enabled
Network connectivity can be controlled for testing
Alert notification system is configured and operational

steps.action: Verify biometric device status on admin dashboard shows 'Connected' with green indicator
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays device status as 'Connected' with last heartbeat timestamp within the last minute

steps.action: Note the current timestamp and number of attendance events received
steps.expectedResult: Baseline metrics are recorded for comparison after reconnection

steps.action: Simulate biometric device disconnection by disabling network connection or stopping the device service
steps.expectedResult: Network connection to biometric device is interrupted

steps.action: Monitor the admin dashboard for device status change
steps.expectedResult: Within 30 seconds, device status changes to 'Disconnected' with red indicator and timestamp of disconnection

steps.action: Check for admin alert notification regarding device disconnection
steps.expectedResult: Alert notification is displayed on dashboard and/or sent via configured channel (email/SMS) with message 'Biometric Device [device-id] disconnected at [timestamp]'

steps.action: Verify system logs contain disconnection event entry
steps.expectedResult: System log shows entry with severity 'Warning', message 'Device disconnection detected', device ID, and timestamp

steps.action: Observe system behavior during disconnection period for 2 minutes
steps.expectedResult: System continues normal operation for other connected devices and displays disconnection status for affected device

steps.action: Restore the biometric device connection by re-enabling network or restarting device service
steps.expectedResult: Network connection to biometric device is restored

steps.action: Monitor admin dashboard for automatic reconnection attempt
steps.expectedResult: Within 1 minute, system detects device availability and initiates reconnection automatically without manual intervention

steps.action: Verify device status changes to 'Connected' on admin dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Device status indicator turns green showing 'Connected' with reconnection timestamp

steps.action: Check for reconnection success notification on admin dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Notification displays 'Biometric Device [device-id] reconnected successfully at [timestamp]'

steps.action: Simulate a new attendance event on the reconnected biometric device
steps.expectedResult: Attendance event is captured and transmitted to the system successfully

steps.action: Verify the new attendance event is received and stored in the database within 1 minute
steps.expectedResult: Database contains the new attendance record confirming data collection has resumed

steps.action: Review system logs for the disconnection period
steps.expectedResult: Logs contain entries documenting: disconnection timestamp, disconnection duration, reconnection timestamp, and confirmation that no data was received during disconnection period

steps.action: Verify no data loss by confirming that system properly logged the disconnection period and resumed normal operation
steps.expectedResult: System logs clearly indicate the disconnection window, no corrupted data was stored, and normal operation resumed immediately after reconnection

postconditions: Biometric device is reconnected and operational
System is actively receiving attendance events
Disconnection period is logged with start and end timestamps
Admin dashboard shows current connected status
No data corruption occurred during disconnection/reconnection cycle
System is ready to handle future disconnection events

storyTitle: As Attendance System Administrator, I want to integrate badge scan systems to achieve comprehensive attendance data aggregation

testCases.title: Validate successful badge scan data ingestion
preconditions: Admin user has valid credentials and access to admin interface
Badge scan system is operational and network accessible
Badge scan system API credentials are available
Attendance database is operational
At least one employee badge is registered in the system
System supports 5000 events per minute throughput

steps.action: Log into the admin interface using valid administrator credentials
steps.expectedResult: Admin dashboard is displayed with navigation menu and system status overview

steps.action: Navigate to badge scan system integration configuration section
steps.expectedResult: Badge scan system configuration page is displayed with connection settings form

steps.action: Enter badge scan system API endpoint URL in the configuration field
steps.expectedResult: API endpoint URL is accepted and displayed in the input field

steps.action: Enter authentication credentials (API key or username/password) for badge scan system
steps.expectedResult: Authentication credentials are accepted and masked appropriately for security

steps.action: Enter badge scan system identifier and location information
steps.expectedResult: System identifier and location fields are populated correctly

steps.action: Click 'Test Connection' button to verify connectivity to badge scan system
steps.expectedResult: System establishes connection and displays 'Connection Successful' message with badge scan system status as 'Active'

steps.action: Save the badge scan system configuration by clicking 'Save' button
steps.expectedResult: Configuration is saved successfully, confirmation message is displayed, and badge scan system appears in the list of connected systems

steps.action: Navigate to the real-time data monitoring dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Monitoring dashboard displays with badge scan system listed as active data source

steps.action: Simulate a badge scan event by scanning a registered employee badge at the badge reader
steps.expectedResult: Badge reader registers the scan with visual/audio confirmation and transmits event data to the system

steps.action: Monitor the real-time data feed on the admin dashboard for the badge scan event
steps.expectedResult: Badge scan event appears in the dashboard within 1 minute displaying employee ID, badge ID, timestamp, location, and scan type (entry/exit)

steps.action: Record the exact timestamp when the event appears on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Timestamp is recorded for latency verification

steps.action: Calculate the time difference between badge scan occurrence and dashboard display
steps.expectedResult: Time difference is less than 1 minute, confirming real-time ingestion requirement

steps.action: Open database query interface or execute SQL query to retrieve the badge scan attendance record
steps.expectedResult: Database query interface returns the attendance record successfully

steps.action: Verify the database record contains all required fields: employee ID, badge ID, timestamp, location, scan type, and system identifier
steps.expectedResult: All required fields are present and populated with data

steps.action: Compare database record values with the original badge scan event data (employee ID, badge ID, timestamp, location)
steps.expectedResult: All data fields match exactly between badge scan event and database record, confirming data integrity

steps.action: Verify the record timestamp in database matches the badge scan event timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Timestamps match precisely, confirming accurate data capture

postconditions: Badge scan system remains connected and operational
Valid badge scan event is stored in attendance database
Admin dashboard shows active badge scan system status
System is ready to receive subsequent badge scan events
Data integrity is maintained between source and database

testCases.title: Verify duplicate badge scan event filtering
preconditions: Badge scan system is connected and configured
Admin has access to admin dashboard
Duplicate detection mechanism is enabled
Database contains existing attendance records
Test environment allows simulation of duplicate events
Duplicate detection rules are configured (e.g., same employee, same location, within 5 seconds)

steps.action: Log into admin dashboard and navigate to badge scan data monitoring section
steps.expectedResult: Badge scan monitoring interface is displayed with real-time event feed

steps.action: Query the database to get the current count of attendance records for baseline
steps.expectedResult: Current record count is retrieved and documented

steps.action: Prepare a badge scan event with specific employee ID, badge ID, timestamp, and location
steps.expectedResult: Test badge scan event data is prepared with all required fields

steps.action: Send the first badge scan event to the system via badge scan API endpoint
steps.expectedResult: System receives and processes the event successfully, returns HTTP 200 status

steps.action: Verify the first event is stored in the database by querying for the specific employee ID and timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Database query returns one record matching the event details

steps.action: Immediately send an identical duplicate badge scan event with the same employee ID, badge ID, timestamp, and location
steps.expectedResult: System receives the duplicate event transmission

steps.action: Observe system response to the duplicate event submission
steps.expectedResult: System detects duplicate and returns HTTP 200 status with message 'Duplicate event detected and filtered'

steps.action: Query the database again for records matching the employee ID and timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Database query returns only one record, confirming duplicate was not stored

steps.action: Verify the total record count in database has increased by only one since baseline
steps.expectedResult: Record count shows increment of 1, confirming only the first event was stored

steps.action: Send a third duplicate event with the same details
steps.expectedResult: System receives the third duplicate event

steps.action: Check system logs for duplicate event entries
steps.expectedResult: System logs contain entries for both duplicate events with severity 'Info', message 'Duplicate badge scan event filtered', employee ID, timestamp, and badge ID

steps.action: Navigate to admin dashboard duplicate event alerts section
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays duplicate event alerts panel

steps.action: Verify duplicate event alerts show the number of duplicates detected and details
steps.expectedResult: Alert displays '2 duplicate events detected for Employee [employee-id] at [timestamp] from Location [location]'

steps.action: Check the duplicate events report or statistics section on dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard shows duplicate event statistics including count, affected employees, and time range

steps.action: Send a valid non-duplicate badge scan event with different timestamp (6 seconds later) for the same employee
steps.expectedResult: System accepts and stores the new event as it falls outside duplicate detection window

steps.action: Verify the new event is stored in database as a separate record
steps.expectedResult: Database now contains two records for the employee with different timestamps, confirming duplicate filtering only affects true duplicates

postconditions: Only unique badge scan events are stored in database
All duplicate events are logged with complete details
Admin dashboard displays duplicate event alerts and statistics
System continues to accept valid non-duplicate events
Data integrity is maintained without duplicate records

testCases.title: Test automatic reconnection on badge scan system failure
preconditions: Badge scan system is connected and actively sending data
Admin is logged into admin dashboard
Automatic reconnection feature is enabled with retry configuration
Network connectivity can be controlled for testing
Alert notification system is operational
System has retry interval configured (e.g., retry every 30 seconds)

steps.action: Access admin dashboard and navigate to badge scan system status monitoring page
steps.expectedResult: Status monitoring page displays badge scan system with 'Connected' status and green indicator

steps.action: Verify the last successful data transmission timestamp is recent (within last minute)
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard shows last data received timestamp within the last 60 seconds

steps.action: Document the current connection status, uptime, and number of events received
steps.expectedResult: Baseline metrics are recorded: status 'Connected', uptime duration, event count

steps.action: Simulate badge scan system disconnection by disabling network connection, stopping the badge scan service, or blocking API endpoint
steps.expectedResult: Network connection to badge scan system is interrupted and system becomes unreachable

steps.action: Monitor the admin dashboard for system detection of the failure
steps.expectedResult: Within 30-60 seconds, dashboard detects connection failure and updates status

steps.action: Verify badge scan system status changes to 'Disconnected' or 'Failed' with red indicator
steps.expectedResult: Status indicator turns red, displays 'Disconnected', and shows timestamp of failure detection

steps.action: Check for admin alert notification regarding badge scan system failure
steps.expectedResult: Alert notification appears on dashboard with message 'Badge Scan System [system-id] at [location] disconnected at [timestamp]' and severity level 'Critical'

steps.action: Verify alert is sent through configured notification channels (email, SMS, or in-app)
steps.expectedResult: Alert notification is delivered through all configured channels with failure details

steps.action: Check system logs for failure detection entry
steps.expectedResult: System log contains entry with timestamp, severity 'Error', message 'Badge scan system connection failed', system ID, and error details

steps.action: Observe dashboard for automatic reconnection attempts indicator
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard shows 'Attempting to reconnect...' message with retry counter or progress indicator

steps.action: Wait for one retry interval (e.g., 30 seconds) and verify system attempts reconnection
steps.expectedResult: System log shows reconnection attempt with timestamp and attempt number

steps.action: Allow system to continue retry attempts while badge scan system remains disconnected for 2 minutes
steps.expectedResult: System continues automatic retry attempts at configured intervals without manual intervention

steps.action: Restore the badge scan system connection by re-enabling network, restarting service, or unblocking API endpoint
steps.expectedResult: Badge scan system becomes reachable and operational again

steps.action: Monitor dashboard for successful automatic reconnection
steps.expectedResult: Within one retry interval (30-60 seconds), system detects availability and successfully reconnects

steps.action: Verify badge scan system status changes to 'Connected' with green indicator
steps.expectedResult: Status indicator turns green, displays 'Connected', and shows reconnection timestamp

steps.action: Check for reconnection success notification on admin dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Success notification displays 'Badge Scan System [system-id] reconnected successfully at [timestamp]' with severity 'Info'

steps.action: Verify system logs contain reconnection success entry
steps.expectedResult: Log entry shows timestamp, message 'Badge scan system reconnected successfully', system ID, downtime duration, and number of retry attempts

steps.action: Simulate a new badge scan event by scanning an employee badge
steps.expectedResult: Badge reader captures the scan and transmits event to the system

steps.action: Verify the new badge scan event is received and displayed on the dashboard within 1 minute
steps.expectedResult: Event appears on dashboard with all details confirming data ingestion has resumed

steps.action: Query the database to confirm the new event is stored successfully
steps.expectedResult: Database contains the new badge scan record with correct timestamp and details, confirming full operational recovery

steps.action: Review complete system logs for the entire disconnection and reconnection cycle
steps.expectedResult: Logs provide complete audit trail: failure detection, retry attempts, reconnection success, and resumption of data ingestion

postconditions: Badge scan system is reconnected and fully operational
System is actively receiving and storing badge scan events
Disconnection period is logged with start time, end time, and duration
Admin dashboard shows current connected status
All reconnection attempts are logged
System is ready to handle future connection failures with automatic recovery
No data corruption occurred during failure and recovery cycle

storyTitle: As Attendance System Administrator, I want to monitor data ingestion health to achieve reliable attendance data availability

testCases.title: Validate ingestion health dashboard updates
preconditions: User is logged in with admin credentials
Ingestion system is running and processing data
Dashboard monitoring service is active
Test environment has access to ingestion health dashboard URL
At least one data source is configured for ingestion

steps.action: Navigate to the ingestion health dashboard URL (GET /monitoring/ingestion)
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully and displays current ingestion status with recent metrics including timestamp, data source status, records processed, and last update time within the last minute

steps.action: Observe the dashboard for 2 minutes without any interaction
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard automatically refreshes every minute showing updated metrics and timestamps reflecting the refresh cycle

steps.action: Simulate an ingestion failure by stopping the data ingestion service or disconnecting a data source
steps.expectedResult: Within 1-2 minutes, dashboard status changes to 'Failed' or 'Error' state with red indicator, error message is displayed, and timestamp shows when failure was detected

steps.action: Check the alerts section or notification panel on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Alert is generated and displayed showing failure details including affected data source, failure time, and error type

steps.action: Navigate to the historical logs section from the dashboard menu
steps.expectedResult: Historical logs page loads displaying a chronological list of ingestion events

steps.action: Review the historical logs for the simulated failure event
steps.expectedResult: Logs show detailed ingestion events including the failure event with timestamp, data source name, error message, stack trace or error details, and event severity level

steps.action: Filter logs by date range to view events from the last hour
steps.expectedResult: Logs are filtered correctly showing only events within the specified time range including the recent failure

postconditions: Dashboard continues to display real-time status
Alert remains visible until acknowledged or issue is resolved
Historical logs are preserved and accessible
Simulated failure is documented in the system
Test data source can be restored to normal operation

testCases.title: Verify admin access control
preconditions: Test environment has both admin and non-admin user accounts configured
Non-admin user credentials are available (username and password)
Admin user credentials are available (username and password)
Ingestion health dashboard URL is accessible
Authentication system is functioning properly

steps.action: Log out from any existing session and clear browser cache/cookies
steps.expectedResult: User is logged out successfully and session is cleared

steps.action: Log in to the system using non-admin user credentials
steps.expectedResult: Login is successful and user is redirected to the default landing page for non-admin users

steps.action: Attempt to access the ingestion health dashboard by navigating to GET /monitoring/ingestion URL
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with HTTP 403 Forbidden error or user is redirected to an 'Access Denied' page with message indicating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Verify that no dashboard data or metrics are visible in the response
steps.expectedResult: No sensitive ingestion data, metrics, or dashboard components are displayed or accessible in the page source

steps.action: Log out from the non-admin account
steps.expectedResult: User is logged out successfully and redirected to login page

steps.action: Log in to the system using admin user credentials
steps.expectedResult: Login is successful and admin user is authenticated

steps.action: Navigate to the ingestion health dashboard URL (GET /monitoring/ingestion)
steps.expectedResult: Access is granted and dashboard loads successfully displaying all ingestion health metrics, status indicators, alerts, and navigation options

steps.action: Verify all dashboard features are accessible including real-time metrics, historical logs, and alert configurations
steps.expectedResult: All admin-level features are visible and functional with no access restrictions

postconditions: Non-admin user remains unable to access monitoring dashboard
Admin user retains full access to all monitoring features
Access control logs record both denied and successful access attempts
No security vulnerabilities are exposed during testing
User sessions are properly managed

storyTitle: As Attendance System Administrator, I want to validate incoming attendance data to achieve data integrity

testCases.title: Validate acceptance of correct attendance data
preconditions: User has admin or system-level access to submit attendance events
Attendance validation API endpoint (POST /attendance/validate) is accessible
Database is running and accepting connections
Valid employee IDs exist in the system database
System clock is synchronized for accurate timestamp validation

steps.action: Prepare a valid attendance event JSON payload with all required fields: employee ID (existing in system), timestamp (current date/time in ISO 8601 format), event type (e.g., 'check-in' or 'check-out'), and location
steps.expectedResult: Valid JSON payload is created with proper schema structure and all mandatory fields populated with correct data types

steps.action: Send POST request to /attendance/validate endpoint with the valid attendance event payload
steps.expectedResult: API accepts the request and returns HTTP 200 OK status code

steps.action: Review the API response body for validation confirmation
steps.expectedResult: Response contains success message indicating event passed validation with details such as validation_status: 'passed', event_id, and timestamp of validation

steps.action: Measure and record the response time from request submission to response receipt
steps.expectedResult: Validation process completes in under 500 milliseconds as indicated by response time metrics

steps.action: Query the attendance database to verify the event was stored
steps.expectedResult: Attendance event is successfully stored in the database with all field values matching the submitted payload including employee ID, timestamp, event type, and location

steps.action: Check validation logs for the processed event
steps.expectedResult: Validation log entry exists showing successful validation with event details, validation timestamp, and 'accepted' status

postconditions: Valid attendance event is persisted in the database
Validation log contains successful validation entry
System remains ready to process subsequent events
No error notifications are generated
Database integrity is maintained

testCases.title: Verify rejection of invalid attendance data
preconditions: User has admin or system-level access to submit attendance events
Attendance validation API endpoint (POST /attendance/validate) is accessible
Validation error logging system is active
Admin notification system is configured and operational
Database is running and accessible

steps.action: Prepare an invalid attendance event JSON payload with missing employee ID field but including other fields like timestamp and event type
steps.expectedResult: Invalid JSON payload is created with employee ID field intentionally omitted or set to null

steps.action: Send POST request to /attendance/validate endpoint with the invalid attendance event payload
steps.expectedResult: API receives the request and processes it through validation logic

steps.action: Review the API response status code
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 400 Bad Request status code indicating validation failure

steps.action: Examine the API response body for error details
steps.expectedResult: Response contains error message clearly stating 'Missing required field: employee_id' or similar, with validation_status: 'failed' and list of validation errors

steps.action: Query the attendance database to confirm the invalid event was not stored
steps.expectedResult: Database does not contain the invalid attendance event, confirming rejection prevented data storage

steps.action: Check the validation error logs for the rejected event
steps.expectedResult: Error log entry exists with details including timestamp, rejected payload, specific validation error (missing employee_id), and rejection reason

steps.action: Verify admin notification system for validation error alert
steps.expectedResult: Admin receives notification (email, dashboard alert, or system message) containing validation error details including event timestamp, error type, missing field information, and payload summary

steps.action: Measure the validation response time
steps.expectedResult: Validation and rejection process completes within 500 milliseconds

postconditions: Invalid attendance event is not stored in the database
Error log contains detailed rejection entry
Admin is notified of validation failure
System continues to operate normally and accept subsequent valid events
Data integrity is preserved

testCases.title: Test duplicate event detection
preconditions: User has admin or system-level access to submit attendance events
Attendance validation API endpoint (POST /attendance/validate) is accessible
Database contains at least one existing attendance event for testing
Duplicate detection mechanism is enabled in the validation system
Validation logs are accessible and recording events

steps.action: Prepare a valid attendance event JSON payload with all required fields: employee ID, timestamp, event type, and location
steps.expectedResult: Valid JSON payload is created with complete and correct data

steps.action: Send POST request to /attendance/validate endpoint with the attendance event payload for the first time
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 200 OK and event is accepted, validated, and stored successfully in the database

steps.action: Verify the first event is stored by querying the database using employee ID and timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Database query returns the stored attendance event with all field values matching the submitted payload

steps.action: Immediately send another POST request to /attendance/validate endpoint with the exact same attendance event payload (duplicate)
steps.expectedResult: API receives the duplicate request and processes it through validation and duplicate detection logic

steps.action: Review the API response status code for the duplicate submission
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 409 Conflict or HTTP 200 OK with duplicate detection message indicating the event was identified as a duplicate

steps.action: Examine the API response body for duplicate detection details
steps.expectedResult: Response contains message such as 'Duplicate event detected and discarded' with details including original event timestamp and duplicate detection criteria (matching employee_id, timestamp, event_type)

steps.action: Query the database to confirm only one instance of the event exists
steps.expectedResult: Database query returns only one record for the specific employee ID and timestamp combination, confirming duplicate was not stored

steps.action: Check validation logs for duplicate detection entry
steps.expectedResult: Log entry exists showing duplicate detection with details including original event ID, duplicate submission timestamp, and 'discarded' status

steps.action: Measure the duplicate detection response time
steps.expectedResult: Duplicate detection and rejection process completes within 500 milliseconds

postconditions: Only one instance of the attendance event exists in the database
Duplicate event is logged but not stored
System maintains data integrity without duplicate records
Validation logs contain both acceptance and duplicate detection entries
System remains operational for processing new unique events
